Sweet Potato Gnocchi with Zucchini Crema and Chicken Meatballs

Prep: 25 min Cook: 25 min Servings: 4-6
italian chicken pasta

Ingredients

For the Chicken Meatballs

For the Zucchini Crema

For the Gnocchi

Instructions

Prepare the Chicken Meatballs

  1. Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan). Line a baking tray with parchment paper and lightly oil.
  2. In a large bowl, combine ground chicken (500g), breadcrumbs (50g), egg, minced garlic (2 cloves), parsley (3 tbsp), Parmesan (30g), salt (1 tsp), and pepper (½ tsp). Mix gently with your hands until just combined (don't overmix - chicken can become tough).
  3. Form into 20-24 small meatballs, about 3cm diameter each. Place on prepared baking tray, spacing 2cm apart. Brush tops lightly with olive oil for better browning.
  4. Bake for 15-18 minutes, turning once at 8 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature 74°C). Keep warm.

Make the Zucchini Crema

  1. Wash and slice zucchini into rounds about 0.5cm thick. Peel and lightly smash garlic cloves (2).
  2. Heat olive oil (60ml) in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry zucchini slices in batches until golden brown and soft, about 3-4 minutes per side. Season with salt and pepper while cooking.
  3. Reserve 8-10 of the best slices for garnish. Place remaining fried zucchini in a blender with garlic cloves, grated cheese (60g), mint (2 tsp), and any remaining oil from the pan. Blend until smooth and creamy.

Cook and Pan-Fry the Gnocchi

  1. Bring a large pot of water to boil (use kettle to speed up) and salt generously. Add fresh gnocchi (450g) and cook for 1-2 minutes until they float to the surface. Drain gnocchi well.
  2. Heat butter (30g) in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add drained gnocchi and fry for 3-4 minutes, turning gently, until golden and slightly crispy on the outside.

Assemble and Serve

  1. Pour the zucchini crema into a large serving bowl. Add the pan-fried gnocchi and toss gently. Add warm salted water (from kettle) a little at a time if needed to achieve a silky sauce consistency.
  2. Gently fold in the warm chicken meatballs. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
  3. Divide between plates. Garnish with reserved fried zucchini slices. Sprinkle with extra grated cheese. Drizzle with a little extra virgin olive oil if desired.

Notes

Chef's Tips:

  • Chicken meatballs are more delicate than pork - handle gently and don't overmix
  • Baking is perfect for chicken meatballs as it keeps them moist
  • The slightly shorter cooking time (15-18 minutes vs 18-20) prevents them from drying out
  • Fresh herbs like basil or thyme would also work beautifully with chicken

Wine Pairing:
A crisp white wine like Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc would complement the lighter chicken and fresh zucchini flavors perfectly.
